title: A mixed bag
text:
On the one hand, its seems it is finally more of a native Mac OS app (at least no longer Electron, thankfully)

Text input and contextual menus seem a lot better than the last time I attempted the official app.

On the other, seems like as with any big updates there are some growing pains for users.

I'm overall happier stepping back into this app now that memory usage is way lower than before, that I can mostly move back from ChatMate Pro (which has its share of bugs and seems like they might not be allowing that client much anymore soon)

Still, I don't know that it is as good as a Mac app should be. Hopefully they keep improving things now that there is likely more code sharing with the main iOS app.

title: Said I was a spammer when adding one person to a chat
text: I added one friend to a chat thread, and I was flagged as a spammer. This also happened when I was traveling overseas, and WhatsApp was the primary source of communication between myself and my schoolmates. The app left me vulnerable and without important communications for over 24 hours while it reviewed my request to not be labeled as a spammer.
